experiment_info.name: cmaes_early_stopping
experiment_info.description: Stop CMA-ES early if converged, reallocate budget to NM polish
experiment_info.hypothesis: Many samples converge quickly. Early stopping could save time for more polish iterations.

tuning_runs.notes: Early stopping NEVER triggered - 0 saved fevals across all 80 samples

conclusion: FAILED - Early stopping never triggers with 1%/3gen threshold. CMA-ES continues improving throughout its full budget. The hypothesis that 'many samples converge quickly' is NOT validated. Time is 5.4x over budget due to stagnation tracking overhead.
key_findings: Early stopping with 1% threshold for 3 generations NEVER triggers
CMA-ES continues making >1% improvements throughout optimization
No fevals are saved, so no extra polish iterations are added
The overhead from stagnation tracking adds 5.4x to runtime
Prior evidence (EXP_ADAPTIVE_BUDGET_001) confirmed: early termination hurts
recommendation: ABANDON early stopping approaches. CMA-ES needs its full budget to achieve good results. The optimization landscape does not exhibit early convergence.
